summary: The Andes are the world's longest mountain range, stretching 5,530 miles along South America's western edge. They pass through seven countries, reaching their highest point at Aconcagua in Argentina, which stands at about 22,838 feet tall. The Andes are divided into three climate zones: Tropical, Dry, and Wet. They also include high plateaus where major cities like La Paz and Quito are located. The Altiplano Plateau is the second highest in the world after the Tibetan Plateau.
title: Andes
